reg.name: Temperature low alarm point sensor 1
reg.description: 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. This value is read and written degrees Celsius. Note that the value stored in this register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers.

reg.description: 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. This value is read and written degrees Celsius. Note that the value stored in this register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers.

bit.description: Set when temperature goes above high temperature alarmpoint.

event.name: Temperature measurement
event.description: The temperature is reported as a normalized integer value by this event.

data.name: format
data.description: format is the measurement data coding format described in the VSCP specification Bits 5,6,7 is set to 0x08 - Normalized integer format. Bits 3,4 0x00 - Kelvin, 0x01 – Celsius, 0x02 – Fahrenheit. Bits 1,2,3 0x00 for sensor 1, 0x01 for sensor 2.

data.name: exponent
data.description: This value is always 2 meaning two decimals.

data.name: Alarm type
data.description: A code that tells which alarm type that occured.

item.name: Temperature over limit
item.description: Temperature is above the set high alarm trigger point.

item.name: Temperature under limit
item.description: Temperature is under the set low alarm trigger point.

data.name: Alarm register
data.description: Current content of module alarm register.

data.name: Sensor index
data.description: Index for the sensor that an alarm occured for.

event.name: Error
event.description: An error message is sent out if a failure is detected with the module or one of the sensors.

data.name: Error type
data.description: A code that tells which error has occured.
